Siap-Siap, Tol Dalam Kota Naik 6-7%
06 Nov 2019, 08:36 by Rifkianto Nugroho
 Jakarta - Jika tak ada aral melintang, bulan ini akan ada sejumlah ruas tol yang tarifnya naik. Salah satu tol yang mengalami kenaikan dalam tol dalam kota.



Sejumlah kendaraan memasuki gerbang tol Semanggi I, Rabu (6/11/2019). 



Rencananya tarif tol dalam kota akan mengalami kenaikan pada bulan ini.  



Menurut Corporate Finance Group Head Jasa Marga Eka Setya Adrianto, kenaikan tarif tol berkisar di antara 6-7% sesuai akumulasi inflasi Jakarta selama dua tahun. 



Selain Dalkot, tarif tol Jakarta-Bogor-Ciawi (Jagorawi) juga akan mengalami penyesuaian. 



Saat ini tarif tol dalam kota untuk kendaraan Golongan I sebesar Rp 9,500, Golongan II Rp 11.500, Golongan III Rp 15.500, Golongan IV Rp 19.000, dan Golongan V Rp 23.000. 



Penyesuaian tarif sendiri sesuai dengan ketetapan yang diatur dalam Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan.  



Penyesuaian tarif tol ini dilakukan setiap dua tahun sekali sesuai dengan isi perjanjian pengusahaan jalan tol (PPJT) yang sudah ditandatangani. 



Selain kedua ruas tersebut, ada pula beberapa ruas tol lainnya di luar Jabodetabek yang akan alami penyesuaian. Tol di luar Jabodetabek yang akan mengalami kenaikan di antaranya Belmera (Belawan-Medan-Tanjung Morawa), Palikanci (Palimanan-Kanci), dan Surgem (Surabaya-Gempol). 



Tarif tol akan dihitung berdasarkan tiga hal, yakni kemampuan bayar pengguna jalan, besar keuntungan biaya operasi kendaraan (BKBOK) dan kelayakan investasi. Hal ini tertera di Pasal 48 ayat (1) Undang-Undang Nomor 38 Tahun 2004 tentang Jalan.

Getting Ready, Toll Roads in the City Rise 6-7%
Nov 6 2019, 08:36 by Rifkianto Nugroho
Jakarta - If nothing gets in the way, this month there will be a number of toll roads whose tariffs will rise. One of the tolls that experienced an increase in tolls in the city.



A number of vehicles entered the Semanggi I toll gate, Wednesday (11/06/2019).



It is planned that the toll road tariff in the city will increase this month.



According to Jasa Marga Corporate Finance Group Head Eka Setya Adrianto, the toll tariff increase ranges between 6-7% according to Jakarta's accumulated inflation for two years.



Besides Dalkot, the Jakarta-Bogor-Ciawi (Jagorawi) toll tariff will also be adjusted.



At present the toll rates in cities for Group I vehicles are IDR 9,500, Group II IDR 11,500, Group III IDR 15,500, Group IV IDR 19,000 and Group V IDR 23,000.



The tariff adjustment itself is in accordance with the provisions stipulated in Law Number 38 of 2004 concerning Roads.



This toll tariff adjustment is done every two years in accordance with the contents of the toll road concession agreement (PPJT) that has been signed.



In addition to the two sections, there are also several other toll roads outside Jabodetabek that will experience adjustments. Tolls outside Jabodetabek that will increase include Belmera (Belawan-Medan-Tanjung Morawa), Palikanci (Palimanan-Kanci), and Surgem (Surabaya-Gempol).



Toll rates will be calculated based on three things, namely the ability to pay for road users, the profitability of vehicle operating costs (BKBOK) and investment feasibility. This is stated in Article 48 paragraph (1) of Law Number 38 of 2004 concerning Roads.
